page.title: 07MAYOR OF TEWKESBURY BOROUGH
page.content: MRS. ROBERTS WAS MAYOR OF TEWKESBURY BOROUGH DURING 1984-85 (CHURCHDOWN IS IN TEWKESBURY BOROUGH). SHE ATTENDED 170 COMMITTEE MEETINGS AND CHAIRED MANY OF THEM. YOU HAVE TO BE DEPUTY MAYOR BEFORE YOU BECOME MAYOR. THE MAYOR IS ALWAYS ADDRESSED AS 'MR. MAYOR' EVEN IF A WOMAN HOLDS THE OFFICE. YOU CANNOT LOSE YOUR SEAT UNLESS YOU DIE OR COMMIT A CRIMINAL OFFENCE. BEING A MAYOR IS VOLUNTARY WORK. THE HOURS THAT MRS. ROBERTS WORKED WERE 7.30 A.M. UNTIL 2.00 A.M. SHE NEVER LOST ANY FRIENDS BUT HAD MANY THREATENING TELEPHONE CALLS. DISADVANTAGES WERE USING HER OWN CAR, HAVING TO PAY FOR ALL THE PETROL AND MISSING OUT ON FAMILY LIFE. MRS. ROBERTS IS STILL AN ELECTED COUNCILLOR FOR CHURCHDOWN PARISH, BUT DOES NOT WANT TO BE MAYOR AGAIN.
